context: The word 'ootad' is the second person singular form of the Estonian verb 'ootama', which means 'to wait'. It specifically refers to what one person (you) does, either alone or in relation to others. The verb can be used both transitively and intransitively - when waiting for someone/something ('ootad mind' - you wait for me) or simply waiting in general ('mida oote?' - what are you waiting for?).
